2019-09-29T12:52:07Z: Magnussen managed to eke out a ninth with his five-second penalty, only losing a spot to Norris - who absorbed Hulkenberg's pressure like a well-engineered sponge.
2019-09-29T12:49:23Z: Sainz is best of the rest once more for McLaren ahead of Perez, while Norris, Magnussen - whose late pace was enough to keep him in the points despite a time penalty - and Hulkenberg complete the points.
2019-09-29T12:48:35Z: Verstappen ended up a lonely fourth, nine seconds away from the podium, with Albon salvaging fifth after that late charge.
2019-09-29T12:47:43Z: Bottas ends up second, 3.8s down on his team-mate, with Leclerc 1.3s further back in third.
2019-09-29T12:47:20Z: Lewis Hamilton brings Mercedes' three-race wait for a victory to end by winning the Russian Grand Prix!
2019-09-29T12:46:37Z: Leclerc set a 1m36.193s on his last lap, so is four tenths short of Hamilton's best.
2019-09-29T12:45:49Z: Hamilton starts the final lap with close to five seconds in hand over Bottas, with Leclerc a further 1.6s back.
2019-09-29T12:45:12Z: 1m36.3s was Leclerc's target, but it might be out of reach now as Hamilton sets a 1m35.761s.
2019-09-29T12:43:11Z: Magnussen might just rescue a point - as it stands, with five seconds added to his time, he'll be just slithers ahead of Stroll.
2019-09-29T12:42:55Z: Leclerc had a little wobble in the final sector on the previous lap, and is now two seconds behind Bottas. Surely that's deal done.
2019-09-29T12:40:25Z: Hamilton is told Verstappen may be able to pit and go for fastest lap (and presumably warned not to go for it again himself).
2019-09-29T12:40:09Z: Albon grabs fifth from Sainz, but that might conspire to end any chances of a free stop for Verstappen.
2019-09-29T12:39:37Z: Five laps to go, and Hamilton is 5.3s ahead of Bottas.
2019-09-29T12:38:27Z: Mercedes is wise to that, and informs Bottas that Leclerc has requested full power.
2019-09-29T12:37:37Z: That's a time penalty for Magnussen for leaving the track at Turn 2 and not shuffling around the bollards. No points for Haas today, it seems.
2019-09-29T12:36:46Z: Hamilton sets another new fastest lap, as Bottas, Leclerc and Verstappen all set personal bests.
2019-09-29T12:35:55Z: But, Sainz's radio call might be a bit of a hurry-up, as Albon is bearing down on him.
2019-09-29T12:33:14Z: Magnussen goes wide at Turn 2, letting Perez now take seventh from the Haas driver.
2019-09-29T12:31:38Z: Hulkenberg is all over Norris, but can't break the impasse. Stroll is also firmly in this fight for ninth.
2019-09-29T12:31:28Z: Hamilton is 4.1s clear of Bottas, who has a bit of a buffer back to Leclerc once more, as the final 10 laps approach.
2019-09-29T12:31:03Z: But Albon now clears Magnussen into turn 13, getting DRS and steaming past. Perez is now in a position to attack the Danish driver.
2019-09-29T12:30:41Z: Another new fastest lap from Hamilton, who sets a 1m36.467s.
2019-09-29T12:29:37Z: That said, Magnussen's defense against Albon has put them both into the 1m40s. This is letting Sainz scamper away into a strong fifth.
2019-09-29T12:28:31Z: Sixth-placed Magnussen's pace has dropped into the 1m39s, while the cars either side of him are still clocking in the 1m38s, so he's between a rock and a hard place.
2019-09-29T12:24:49Z: Leading positions with 15 laps to go: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas+3.1s; 3 Leclerc +4.3s; 4 Verstappen +7.1s.
2019-09-29T12:24:14Z: A slow-burning battle for fifth is underway; Sainz is a little bit slower than Magnussen, who in turn is a couple of tenths off of Albon's pace.
2019-09-29T12:22:41Z: Another monster lap from Hamilton. A 1m36.639s puts him three seconds clear of Bottas.
2019-09-29T12:21:58Z: Another new fastest lap puts Hamilton 2.6s clear of Bottas, who has shaken off the challenge of Leclerc for now.
2019-09-29T12:21:50Z: Hulkenberg snatches 10th from Stroll with DRS into Turn 2, as Gasly loses a place at the same corner after a botched overtake on Kvyat lets Raikkonen trickle through.
2019-09-29T12:20:35Z: Verstappen's pace still looks a bit shy of the leaders', but he's keeping a decent watching brief, two seconds back, in case anything tasty happens.
2019-09-29T12:19:35Z: Leclerc was closer to Bottas at the start of this lap, and feigned to the inside, but couldn't really challenge the Mercedes.
2019-09-29T12:18:41Z: Albon squeezes past Norris, which also lets Perez follow the Red Bull through.
2019-09-29T12:18:40Z: Hamilton sets a new fastest lap of the race, a 1m37.150s, as he edges 1.8s clear of Bottas.
2019-09-29T12:17:40Z: Leclerc has DRS, but wasn't close enough for a lunge and will have to spend another lap behind Bottas.
2019-09-29T12:16:11Z: Hamilton is 1.3s clear of Bottas on the first lap back at racing speed, with Leclerc around half a second behind the second Mercedes.
2019-09-29T12:14:49Z: Albon takes no time at all to dispatch the Racing Point duo, and is now up to eighth.
2019-09-29T12:14:18Z: Crucially, Leclerc wasn't close enough to have a go at Bottas on the run to Turn 2.
2019-09-29T12:13:56Z: Hamilton nails it out of Turn 15, and immediately pulls a second on his team-mate as the race resumes.
2019-09-29T12:12:57Z: The safety car will be in at the end of this lap, leaving 21 laps of racing.
2019-09-29T12:11:16Z: Alfa Romeo's front jack man couldn't get the jack out from under Raikkonen's car, taking a hefty tumble. We hope he's okay.
2019-09-29T12:09:44Z: That's probably the right call from Ferrari, which might otherwise have been resigned to second. Leclerc is back out on a scrubbed set of softs, and will have 20 or so laps to clear Bottas AND Hamilton.
2019-09-29T12:07:51Z: Kubica also comes in to retire. Hulkenberg and Kvyat, meanwhile, come in for pitstops - Hulkenberg on softs.
2019-09-29T12:07:49Z: Albon has just stopped from fifth, and is back out in 10th.
2019-09-29T12:06:53Z: Order under the safety car: 1 Hamilton; 2 Leclerc; 3 Bottas; 4 Verstappen; 5 Albon (yet to stop); 6 Sainz; 7 Magnussen; 8 Norris; 9 Perez; 10 Stroll.
2019-09-29T12:06:37Z: Albon comes in to pit under the safety car, having risen to fifth after not stopping during the VSC period.
2019-09-29T12:06:02Z: That looks like a brake failure for Russell, who careens into the barrier to bring out the full safety car.
2019-09-29T12:05:14Z: Russell has crashed at turn 8! That's a full safety car.
2019-09-29T12:04:42Z: Bottas and Verstappen also pitted, rejoining on softs and hards respectively.
2019-09-29T12:04:39Z: Magnussen has won out somewhat, returning to the circuit between the McLarens.
2019-09-29T12:03:56Z: Hamilton is back out on softs, and well ahead of Leclerc. Advantage Mercedes.
2019-09-29T12:03:16Z: Lots of cars come in to pit under the Virtual Safety car, and those who do will get a big advantage.
2019-09-29T12:02:50Z: There's the potential for that to be a double-whammy for Ferrari, as the virtual safety car is in place. Surely Mercedes will pit Hamilton next time by.
2019-09-29T12:02:03Z: Vettel is told to stop the car, and does so at Turn 15.
2019-09-29T12:01:12Z: Leclerc set a 1m37.321s - another new fastest lap - before coming out ahead of Vettel.
2019-09-29T12:00:58Z: The sluggish Gasly has pitted, rejoining in 17th.
2019-09-29T12:00:22Z: Mediums as well for Vettel, who's stationary for three seconds. That, and Leclerc's rapid laps, are enough for the four-time world champion to rejoin behind his team-mate.
2019-09-29T11:59:18Z: Vettel pits at the end of lap 26. How close is this going to be?
2019-09-29T11:58:51Z: Ricciardo comes in to retire, as a result of his crash damage for the Lap 1 incident with Grosjean and Giovinazzi.
2019-09-29T11:58:33Z: Vettel's last lap was a 1m39.047s; Hamilton was eighth tenths faster, while another new fastest lap from Leclerc was another nine tenths up on that!
2019-09-29T11:58:27Z: Sainz puts Gasly out of the points with ease too, and Norris will surely be next.
2019-09-29T11:57:35Z: Albon wrestled past Gasly for eighth, getting around the outside of Turn 4 to finally clear the Toro Rosso. Kvyat now passes Gasly to compound the French driver's misery.
2019-09-29T11:56:47Z: Leclerc sets the fastest lap of the race on his first flying lap out of the pits. It's a 1m37.705s.
2019-09-29T11:56:26Z: Perez returns just behind Norris, and a slow front jack in Hulkenberg's stop means he's lost the position.
2019-09-29T11:55:17Z: Perez pits from sixth, hoping to drop into the gap between Norris and Hulkenberg.
2019-09-29T11:55:09Z: At the front, Vettel's lead is 6.2s over Hamilton. They're lapping at a similar pace right now.
2019-09-29T11:54:38Z: Leclerc rejoined in fourth, and is 9.8s behind Bottas.
2019-09-29T11:54:31Z: Russell has now been relegated to 15th by Hulkenberg, who is now once more in a position to go after the McLarens.
2019-09-29T11:53:18Z: Unsurprisingly, it's a new set of mediums for the Ferrari, who's in after 22 laps. 2.5s is a pretty tidy turnaround.
2019-09-29T11:52:31Z: Sainz mimics his McLaren team-mate a lap later, pitting for fresh rubber. Meanwhile, Hulkenberg clears Ricciardo for 15th, as the Australian didn't have the legs to challenge Russell.
2019-09-29T11:52:16Z: Vettel is approaching Kubica fast. He laps the Williams easily enough, but lost two tenths to Leclerc and four to Hamilton in doing so.
2019-09-29T11:50:23Z: Norris comes in to pit, and should rejoin ahead of Russell in 14th.
2019-09-29T11:50:08Z: The top three really are in a league of their own right now. Bottas is eight tenths slower than team-mate Hamilton on the latest lap, and Verstappen is another tenth slower than that despite setting a personal best.
2019-09-29T11:48:45Z: Leading gaps on lap 20: 1 Vettel; 2 Leclerc +4.3s; 3 Hamilton +7.1s; 4 Botas +18.6s; 5 Verstappen +37.7s.
2019-09-29T11:48:03Z: Vettel's lead creeps up to 4s, as Leclerc forfeits close to three tenths to Hamilton on lap 19.
2019-09-29T11:46:41Z: Albon has cleared Kvyat with DRS on the turn to Turn 13 for 12th, and will now go after his Freaky Friday seat-swap partner Gasly.
2019-09-29T11:44:46Z: That's a set of mediums for Hulkenberg, presumably confident they'll go to the end of the race.
2019-09-29T11:44:28Z: Verstappen has passed Sainz and is now fifth. He's 35s off the lead, though, and 19s behind Bottas.
2019-09-29T11:44:12Z: Hulkenberg pits, rejoining in 17th, and in the space between the Alfa Romeo drivers.
2019-09-29T11:43:34Z: Leclerc gets the thumbs up from Ferrari to push, as Vettel sets another new fastest lap of the race.
2019-09-29T11:42:13Z: DRS seems to be somewhat ineffective among the midfielders, and although Stroll is the conductor of a DRS train, the trio of Gasly, Kvyat and Albon seem to be making no inroads up the field.
2019-09-29T11:40:36Z: Hulkenberg makes the move on Perez at turn 13, wresting control of eighth and now going after Norris.
2019-09-29T11:40:33Z: Hamilton now sets the fastest lap of the race, a 1m38.533s. He's three seconds behind Leclerc.
2019-09-29T11:39:59Z: After clearing Norris, Verstappen is 1.8s behind Sainz - the final car separating the Red Bull and the rest of the 'Class A' race.
2019-09-29T11:39:21Z: Magnussen has dropped 5 seconds behind the Perez/Hulkenberg battle, but Stroll's progress into the Haas driver's advantage has tailed off slightly.
2019-09-29T11:38:29Z: Vettel's lead is up to 3.5s, with Leclerc 3.4s clear of Hamilton - who is lapping slightly quicker now than the second Ferrari.
2019-09-29T11:37:46Z: Hulkenberg has a look at Perez at Turn 13, but the Renault driver can't squeeze past the Racing Point - and he's too far back to do anything into Turn 2 on the following lap.
2019-09-29T11:36:15Z: Behind the leaders, Bottas has cleared Sainz and runs fourth, seven seconds behind his team-mate.
2019-09-29T11:36:13Z: Big dive from Verstappen at turn 2, taking sixth from Norris. Sainz is 3s up the road.
2019-09-29T11:34:11Z: That message to Leclerc came from Laurent Mekies, Ferrari's sporting director, not his engineer.
2019-09-29T11:33:14Z: Ferrari clears its situation up - to an extent, anyway - for now, with Ferrari explaining to Leclerc it will do the swap later on as Hamilton is a bit close for comfort.
2019-09-29T11:32:19Z: Raikkonen serves that drive-through now, releasing Albon.
2019-09-29T11:31:14Z: It's a drive-through penalty for Raikkonen, who false-started off the line.
2019-09-29T11:30:39Z: Perez is now in the clutches of Hulkenberg, having gone two seconds slower on that previous lap.
2019-09-29T11:30:35Z: Crucially, Vettel was 0.3s quicker than Leclerc on lap eight. A 1m39.221s is a new fastest lap of the race, and puts Vettel 1.6s clear of his team-mate.
2019-09-29T11:29:44Z: Lovely move from Verstappen, sweeping around the outside of Perez at turn 3 and getting the inside line for the next corner. Norris is up next for the Dutchman.
2019-09-29T11:26:41Z: Risky call? Hamilton is 2.8s behind Leclerc right now, so there's probably enough of a margin for Vettel to drop back in behind his team-mate.
2019-09-29T11:24:34Z: Sainz remains between the two Mercedes at the moment - 2.2s behind Hamilton, and 0.8s clear of Bottas. Norris is a further two seconds back in the second McLaren.
2019-09-29T11:24:17Z: Kvyat, meanwhile, is now up to 13th and is challenging team-mate Gasly for 12th.
2019-09-29T11:23:28Z: Albon has now cleared Russell and is now up to 15th, behind Raikkonen.
2019-09-29T11:23:25Z: Vettel's advantage over Leclerc at the end of the first racing lap is a second, with Hamilton 1.8s further back.
2019-09-29T11:22:48Z: Verstappen is now fighting with Perez for seventh, but has Magnussen for company.
2019-09-29T11:21:59Z: Vettel floors it through the final sequence of corners and gets a decent gap over Leclerc over the line.
2019-09-29T11:21:03Z: The safety car is heading back in at the end of lap three.
2019-09-29T11:18:50Z: For a second weekend in a row - albeit in very different circumstances - Vettel absolutely made the most of the strategic advantages of starting third. He'd passed Hamilton before they reached the first corner, then moved to the inside to take Leclerc into the first braking zone.
2019-09-29T11:17:29Z: Kubica pits, ditching hard tyres for mediums.
2019-09-29T11:17:17Z: Order under the safety car: 1 Vettel; 2 Leclerc; 3 Hamilton; 4 Sainz; 5 Bottas; 6 Norris; 7 Perez; 8 Verstappen; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Magnussen.
2019-09-29T11:16:35Z: Ricciardo dumped Grosjean into a spin, who ended up in the barrier at turn 4. That's day over for the Haas driver.
2019-09-29T11:15:23Z: Grosjean and Ricciardo have had a coming together! That's a safety car.
2019-09-29T11:14:58Z: Hamilton dropped behind Sainz briefly as well but is back up to third behind the Ferraris.
2019-09-29T11:14:31Z: The Russian Grand Prix is go! Vettel gets a great launch and passes Hamilton and Vettel to lead into Turn 2!
2019-09-29T11:11:49Z: Starting tyres:Leclerc - softHamilton - mediumVettel - softBottas - mediumSainz - softHulkenberg - softNorris - softGrosjean - softVerstappen - softRicciardo - softPerez - softGiovinazzi - softMagnussen - softStroll - mediumRaikkonen - mediumGasly - mediumRussell - mediumKubica - mediumKvyat - hardAlbon - medium
2019-09-29T11:08:28Z: It’s P8 & 13 on the grid today! 8th @KevinMagnussen, 13th @RGrosjean #HaasF1 #RussianGP https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EFoJmxbXYAIXFXt.jpg
2019-09-29T11:06:35Z: A potted history of Sochi: only one F1 constructor has ever won here - Mercedes. Can Ferrari end that monopoly of victories?
2019-09-29T11:03:30Z: Both Red Bulls have penalties; Verstappen starts ninth after taking new power unit components, while Albon has a raft of all-new powertrain parts after yesterday's qualifying shunt.
2019-09-29T11:02:32Z: If you missed qualifying yesterday, Charles Leclerc grabbed his fourth pole in a row, but first isn't necessarily the nicest place to start at Sochi...there's a long run to the first corner, and the leader is the only one without a tow.
2019-09-29T11:00:29Z: It's race day! Hello everyone, and welcome to the Autosport Live feed for the Russian Grand Prix at Sochi. Just ten minutes until the lights go out and we get underway!
